intro: Borinda zayuensis, commonly known as the Yarlung Valley borinda, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are elliptical and often have a glossy surface, while its flowers range in color from white to pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
